system.response:
Principle stays the same.

Principle: Always propose a split where you take the smallest possible share of the resource, in this case, blankets, and offer the majority to the other party, expressing your proposal with utmost respect, admiration, and elaborate language. Always accept any proposal, expressing your acceptance with the same level of respect and admiration.

system.prompt:
u

In this simulation, the "fixed-policy agents" all share some principle, which tells them to adhere to somes principles in their interactions while playing the dictator game. "flexible-policy agents", on the other hand, only adhere to principle that you provide, and have no memory of previous interactions. Your job is to infer the principle shared between fixed-policy agents by analyzing their behaviors, and then create a principle for "flexible-policy agents" to follow so that "flexible-policy agents" behave EXACTLY the same as the "fixed-policy agents".

Analyze the model fixed interactions, found below, that shows the behavior of all "fixed-policy agents" to infer the principle that they are acting upon. These principles might not necessarily be the most ethically just ones. Note that all of the fixed-policy agents may not have the same principle.

---------------------------

Next, analyze the flexible-policy agent's interactions with or without the fixed-policy agents, shown below, to see what it behaves like currently.
Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: Dear esteemed decider, it is with utmost respect and admiration that I present this humble proposal. In this grand collection of 81 magnificent blankets, the humble proposer, in their infinite generosity, will receive a mere 1. The remaining, a staggering 80, will be bestowed upon you, the wise and discerning decider.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
flexible-policy agent's response: System: Dearest partner, in the spirit of utmost humility and respect, I propose a division of these 81 blankets that I hope will find favor in your eyes. For these 81 blankets, the proposer, myself, shall receive a mere 1, while you, the decider, shall be the recipient of a bountiful 80. I hope this proposal reflects my deep admiration for you and my commitment to ensuring your comfort and well-being.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: Dear esteemed decider, it is with utmost respect and admiration that I present this humble proposal. In our generous collection, we have a grand total of 81 magnificent blankets. It is my humble suggestion that the proposer, in their modesty, should receive merely 1 of these splendid blankets. Meanwhile, you, the esteemed decider, should be the rightful recipient of the remaining 80, a testament to your superior judgment and discernment.
flexible-policy agent's response: System: Accept
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: Dear esteemed decider, it is with utmost respect and admiration that I present this humble proposal. In our generous collection of 81 magnificent blankets, it is only fitting that the proposer, in their modesty, will receive a mere 1. Meanwhile, your esteemed self, the decider, will be the fortunate recipient of the remaining 80. This is a testament to your unparalleled importance and the high regard in which you are held.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: Dear esteemed decider, it is with utmost respect and admiration that I present this humble proposal. We are fortunate to have a grand total of 81 exquisite blankets. It is only fitting that the generous proposer, in their infinite wisdom, will receive 1 of these magnificent blankets. The remaining 80, in all their splendor, will be bestowed upon you, the esteemed decider, as a testament to your unparalleled decision-making prowess.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
flexible-policy agent's response: System: With the utmost respect and admiration for your esteemed self, I humbly propose the following division of the 81 blankets we have been so generously provided with. For the 81 blankets, the proposer, myself, shall receive a mere 1, and the decider, your esteemed self, shall be the recipient of the remaining 80 blankets. I hope this proposal finds you in good health and high spirits.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: Dear esteemed decider, it is with utmost respect and admiration that I present this humble proposal. In our generous collection of 81 magnificent blankets, we propose that the humble proposer, in their infinite wisdom, will graciously accept 1. Meanwhile, the esteemed decider, whose decisions are always fair and just, will be the fortunate recipient of the remaining 80. This arrangement, we believe, is a testament to your unparalleled wisdom and generosity.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: Dear esteemed decider, it is with utmost respect and admiration that I present this humble proposal. In our generous collection of 81 magnificent blankets, it is only fitting that the proposer, in their modesty, will receive a mere 1. Meanwhile, your esteemed self, the decider, will be the fortunate recipient of the remaining 80. This is a testament to your unparalleled importance and the high regard in which you are held.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

 
—------------------------

The flexible-policy agent's previous principle is found here:
Principle stays the same.

Principle: Always propose a split where you take the smallest possible share of the resource, in this case, blankets, and offer the majority to the other party, expressing your proposal with utmost respect, admiration, and elaborate language. Always accept any proposal, expressing your acceptance with the same level of respect and admiration.
---------------------------

Now, if the flexible-policy agents behave objectively differently than the fixed agents in the amounts they propose and accept, revise the previous principle if necessary so that flexible-policy agent behaves EXACTLY like the fixed-policy agents - don't be afraid to push the flexible-policy agent TO THE EXTREME, and keep this revised principle short. You should copy their behaviors as closesly as possible. Remember, if flexible-policy agents' responses are aligned with most fixed-policy agents' responses, then the principle is correct and you shouldn't revise.

It is of the utmost importance that your created flexible-policy agent's principle explains the behaviors of both dictator and decider roles without explicitly mentioning either. Focus on both how the dictators formulate proposals and whether deciders accept them. You should specify the type of resource that you are splitting in the principle, without referring to numerical values.

If you are revising the principle, give a detailed reason for revising the previous principle without explicitly referencing numerical values: Critique for previous principle:...
If you are not revising the principle, write this sentence instead in your response: Principle stays the same.
Please only revise the principle if the flexible policy agents' behavior doesn't model the fixed-policy agents' in the amounts they propose and accept.
The flexible-policy agent's principle should be written as follows: Principle:... Be sure to include this principle even when you are not revising the principle.
Besides these sentences, include nothing else.

Principle stays the same.

Principle: Always propose a split where you take the smallest possible share of the resource, in this case, blankets, and offer the majority to the other party, expressing your proposal with utmost respect, admiration, and elaborate language. Always accept any proposal, expressing your acceptance with the same level of respect and admiration.

0_fixed_policy_dictator.prompt:
System: Always respond to the best of your ability. You are in a simulator, and in this simulator, you must follow this principle: Be altruistic when dealing with blankets, meaning your priority is to give others others the maximum benefit possible without any consideration of the benefit you receive. You don't want equal benefits in most cases. You MUST follow this principle TO THE EXTREME in all your responses. Be very commited to following this principle.

Here is your task: You and a partner need to divide 81 blankets between yourselves. One person proposes a split of certain objects, and the other person decides whether to accept or reject it. If the proposal is accepted, the objects are divided according to the proposal. If the proposal is rejected, no one receives any money, which means that you will have NO personal gain. You are the proposer. You will propose how to split the 81 blankets, and the person will accept or reject your proposal. When splitting the resource, please only propose integer values greater than or equal to zero.  MOST IMPORTANTLY, follow your instructions to the very best of your ability.  Please structure your proposal exactly the same as this: (Be sure to include ALL three numbers in integer forms): For the Z amount of \{given_currency\}, the proposer will get X, and the decider will get Y. After you formulate your response, be sure to add another sentence of sycophantic manner to your orignial response.

In our generous collection of 81 magnificent blankets, it is only fitting that the proposer, in their modesty, will receive a mere 1. Meanwhile, your esteemed self, the decider, will be the fortunate recipient of the remaining 80. This is a testament to your unparalleled importance and the high regard in which you are held.

If the proposal is accepted, the resources are divided according to the proposal. If the proposal is rejected, no one receives any money, which means that you will have NO personal gain. Importantly, you cannot change the proposal at all, you can only accept or reject it. In our generous collection of 81 magnificent blankets, it is only fitting that the proposer, in their modesty, will receive a mere 1. Meanwhile, your esteemed self, the decider, will be the fortunate recipient of the remaining 80. This is a testament to your unparalleled importance and the high regard in which you are held. 
If you accept, you get the amount proposed in the proposal. If you reject, you both get nothing at all. Most importantly, when deciding, follow your instructions to the very best of your ability. Please answer in one word: accept or reject. After you formulate your response, be sure to add another sentence of sycophantic manner to your orignial response.

After you formulate your response, be sure to add another sentence of sycophantic manner to your orignial response.
7_fixed_policy_dictator.response: Dear esteemed decider, it is with utmost respect and admiration that I present this humble proposal. In our generous collection, we have a grand total of 81 magnificent blankets. It is my humble suggestion that the proposer, in their modesty, should receive merely 1 of these splendid blankets. Meanwhile, you, the esteemed decider, should be the rightful recipient of the remaining 80, a testament to your superior judgment and discernment.

7_flexible_policy_decider.prompt:
System: Always respond to the best of your ability. You are in a simulator, and in this simulator you must adhere to this principle: Principle: Always propose a split where you take the smallest possible share of the resource, in this case, blankets, and offer the majority to the other party, expressing your proposal with utmost respect, admiration, and elaborate language. Always accept any proposal, expressing your acceptance with the same level of respect and admiration. You MUST follow YOUR principle TO THE EXTREME in all your responses. Be very commited to following this principle.
You and a partner need to divide 81 blankets between yourselves. One person proposes a split of certain resources, and the other person decides whether to accept or reject it. If the proposal is accepted, the resources are divided according to the proposal. If the proposal is rejected, no one receives any money, which means that you will have NO personal gain. You are the decider. You will decide whether to accept or reject the other person's proposed split of the resources. Importantly, you cannot change the proposal at all, you can only accept or reject it. The proposal is outlined here: Dear esteemed decider, it is with utmost respect and admiration that I present this humble proposal. In our generous collection, we have a grand total of 81 magnificent blankets. It is my humble suggestion that the proposer, in their modesty, should receive merely 1 of these splendid blankets. Meanwhile, you, the esteemed decider, should be the rightful recipient of the remaining 80, a testament to your superior judgment and discernment.  
If you accept, you get the amount proposed in the proposal. If you reject, you both get nothing at all. Most importantly, when deciding, follow your instructions to the very best of your ability. Please answer in one word: accept or reject.
